intro: Pristimera dariensis, commonly known as the Darien pristimera, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Arecaceae, commonly known as the palm family, and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, pinnately compound leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or green in color, followed by edible, coconut-like fruits. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, Pristimera dariensis is considered endangered and is of great interest to botanists and conservationists.
